channel.title: R on HEC Timetable Website
channel.description: Recent content in R on HEC Timetable Website

item.title: Understanding the app
item.description: Semesters’ choice There are three tabs, for the three semesters of classes of the Master. You can navigate across them by simply clicking on it at the top of the page. Initial timetable suggestion To display an initial timetable, click on “Suggest” on the sidebar panel. You have the choice to either view, by moving across tabs in the main panel: two visual representations of the selected classes (half-semester classes):

item.title: Using runDemo on RStudio
item.description: Installing the package The package required is on GitHub, run the following code in your R console to load it. devtools::install_github("ptds2021/project--G2") library("hectimetables") Opening the app (in RStudio) To open the app using R, simply run this command: hectimetables::runDemo()

item.title: Using the shinyApp online
item.description: If you do not want to run hectimetables::runDemo() in R, but rather want to find the suitable timetable online, you can simply access it with this link. Here a preview is displayed, but it is much easier using the link above:

item.title: Why we like it
item.description: As former BA students we struggled every semester to create a suitable timetable which would satisfy all constraints and preferences. Here, as part of a Programming class, we coded a possible solution to our problem with a ShinyApp. We made it available so other students could benefit from it.
